metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Git Reflog
What is Git Reflog?
git reflog records updates to the tip of branches and HEAD.
content.html: git reflog records updates to the tip of branches and HEAD.

content.text: It lets you see where your branch and HEAD have been, even changes you made by mistake.
content.html: It lets you see where your branch and HEAD have been, even changes you made by mistake.

content.text: This is useful for recovering lost commits or undoing a reset.
content.html: This is useful for recovering lost commits or undoing a reset.

content.text: When to Use Git Reflog
Use git reflog when you need to:
content.html: Use git reflog when you need to:

content.text: Show the Reflog
To see the history of where HEAD and branches have pointed, use:
content.html: To see the history of where HEAD and branches have pointed, use:

content.code:
git
reflog
e56ba1f (HEAD -> master) HEAD@{0}: commit: Revert "Just a regular update, definitely no accidents here..."
52418f7 HEAD@{1}: commit: Just a regular update, definitely no accidents here...
9a9add8 (origin/master) HEAD@{2}: commit: Added .gitignore
81912ba HEAD@{3}: commit: Corrected spelling error
3fdaa5b HEAD@{4}: merge: Merge pull request #1 from w3schools-test/update-readme
836e5bf HEAD@{5}: commit: Updated readme for GitHub Branches
...
content.code_html:
git reflog
e56ba1f (HEAD -> master) HEAD@{0}: commit: Revert "Just a regular update, definitely no accidents here..."
52418f7 HEAD@{1}: commit: Just a regular update, definitely no accidents here...
9a9add8 (origin/master) HEAD@{2}: commit: Added .gitignore
81912ba HEAD@{3}: commit: Corrected spelling error
3fdaa5b HEAD@{4}: merge: Merge pull request #1 from w3schools-test/update-readme
836e5bf HEAD@{5}: commit: Updated readme for GitHub Branches
...

content.text: This lists recent positions of HEAD, so you can see actions like commits, resets, merges, and checkouts.
content.html: This lists recent positions of HEAD, so you can see actions like commits, resets, merges, and checkouts.

content.text: Find and Recover Lost Commits
If you accidentally reset or deleted commits, you can use the reflog to find the commit and restore it.
content.html: If you accidentally reset or deleted commits, you can use the reflog to find the commit and restore it.

content.text: Each entry in the reflog has a reference like HEAD@ { 2 } .
content.html: Each entry in the reflog has a reference like HEAD@{2}.

content.code:
git
reflog
e56ba1f (HEAD -> master) HEAD@{0}: commit: Revert "Just a regular update, definitely no accidents here..."
52418f7 HEAD@{1}: commit: Just a regular update, definitely no accidents here...
9a9add8 (origin/master) HEAD@{2}: commit: Added .gitignore
81912ba HEAD@{3}: commit: Corrected spelling error
...

git
reset --hard HEAD@
{
2
}

HEAD is now at 9a9add8 Added .gitignore
content.code_html:
git reflog
e56ba1f (HEAD -> master) HEAD@{0}: commit: Revert "Just a regular update, definitely no accidents here..."
52418f7 HEAD@{1}: commit: Just a regular update, definitely no accidents here...
9a9add8 (origin/master) HEAD@{2}: commit: Added .gitignore
81912ba HEAD@{3}: commit: Corrected spelling error
...
git reset --hard HEAD@{2}
HEAD is now at 9a9add8 Added .gitignore

content.text: This puts your branch back to the state it was in at that point.
content.html: This puts your branch back to the state it was in at that point.

content.text: Clean Up the Reflog
The reflog is automatically cleaned by Git, but you can manually expire old entries if needed:
content.html: The reflog is automatically cleaned by Git, but you can manually expire old entries if needed:

content.code:
git
reflog expire --expire
=
30
.days refs/heads/main

git
gc --prune
=
now
Counting objects: 15, done.
Compressing objects: 100% (10/10), done.
Pruning objects
content.code_html:
git reflog expire --expire=30.days refs/heads/main
git gc --prune=now
Counting objects: 15, done.
Compressing objects: 100% (10/10), done.
Pruning objects

content.text: This removes reflog entries older than 30 days for the main branch and runs garbage collection.
content.html: This removes reflog entries older than 30 days for the main branch and runs garbage collection.

content.text: Tips & Best Practices
Troubleshooting
If you encounter issues with git reflog , try:
content.html: If you encounter issues with git reflog, try:

content.text: Warnings
Be careful when using git reflog to recover lost commits or changes, as it can overwrite existing changes.
content.html: Be careful when using git reflog to recover lost commits or changes, as it can overwrite existing changes.
